sen.j: 鷲尾 義久（わしお よしひさ、生年不詳 - 文治5年4月30日 (旧暦)（1189年5月17日）?）は、平安時代末期の武士。
sen.e: Yoshihisa WASHIO (year of birth unknown - May 17, 1189?) is a samurai who lived toward the end of the Heian period.
Yoshihisa WASHIO (year of birth unknown - May 17, 1189?) is a samurai who lived toward the end of the Heian period.
Yoshihisa WASHIO (year of birth unknown - May 17, 1189?) is a samurai who lived toward the end of the Heian period.
He was a retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.
He was a retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.
He was a retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.
His common name was Saburo.
His common name was Saburo.
His common name was Saburo.
According to some sources, his real name was Tsuneharu.
According to some sources, his real name was Tsuneharu.
According to some sources, his real name was Tsuneharu.

sen.j: 『平家物語』の「老馬」の段に登場する（覚一本）。
sen.e: He appears on the scene of 'An Old Horse' in "The Tale of the Heike" (the version edited by Kakuichi AKASHI).
He appears on the scene of 'An Old Horse' in "The Tale of the Heike" (the version edited by Kakuichi AKASHI).
He appears on the scene of 'An Old Horse' in "The Tale of the Heike" (the version edited by Kakuichi AKASHI).

sen.j: 元は播磨国山中にて猟師をしていたという。
sen.e: It is said that before becoming a retainer of Yoshitsune he did hunting in the mountains of the Harima Province for living.
It is said that before becoming a retainer of Yoshitsune he did hunting in the mountains of the Harima Province for living.
It is said that before becoming a retainer of Yoshitsune he did hunting in the mountains of the Harima Province for living.

sen.j: 寿永3年（1184年）、三草山の戦いで平資盛軍を破った義経軍は、山中を更に進軍していくにあたって、土地勘のある者としてこの義久を召し出し、道案内役として使ったという。
sen.e: Yoshitsune's army defeated TAIRA no Sukemori's army in the Battle of Mikusayama in 1184. After this victory Yoshitsune wanted to keep marching in the mountains; so he summoned Yoshihisa as a person who is familiar with the region and used him as a guide.

Yoshitsune's army defeated TAIRA no Sukemori's army in the Battle of Mikusayama in 1184. After this victory Yoshitsune wanted to keep marching in the mountains; so he summoned Yoshihisa who was familiar with the region and used him as a guide.

Yoshitsune's army defeated TAIRA no Sukemori's army in the Battle of Mikusayama in 1184. After this victory Yoshitsune wanted to keep marching in the mountains; so he summoned Yoshihisa who was familiar with the region and used him as a guide.

sen.j: 義経一行が鵯越にたどりつき、一ノ谷の戦いにおいて大勝を収めることができた。
sen.e: Yoshitsune and his party arrived at Hiyodorigoe and they were able to gain a great victory in the Battle of Ichi no Tani. This victory owes a lot to the man who guided the troops and it is said that Yoshitsune gave the name 'Yoshihisa,' which has a part of his own name, to the guide as a prize for the big role he played in the battle.

Yoshitsune and his party arrived at Hiyodorigoe and they were able to gain a great victory in the Battle of Ichi no Tani. This victory owes a lot to Yoshitsune who guided the troops and it is said that Yoshitsune gave him the name 'Yoshihisa,' which had a part of his own name, as a prize for the big role he played in the battle.
Yoshitsune and his party arrived at Hiyodorigoe and they were able to gain a great victory in the Battle of Ichi no Tani.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: これは彼のこの働きによるところが大きく、「義久」という名はその褒賞として義経が自らの一字を与えてつけたものだと言われている。
sen.e: This victory owes a lot to Yoshitsune who guided the troops and it is said that Yoshitsune gave him the name 'Yoshihisa,' which had a part of his own name, as a prize for the big role he played in the battle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 以降、忠実な義経の郎党として付き従い、最後は衣川館にて主君と命運をともにしたという。
sen.e: Since then Yoshihisa followed Yoshitsune as a faithful retainer and it is said that he died with his lord at Koromogawa no Tachi, the residence of Oshu Fujiwara clan.
Since then Yoshihisa followed Yoshitsune as a faithful retainer and it is said that he died with his lord at Koromogawa no Tachi, the residence of the Oshu Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: Since then Yoshihisa followed Yoshitsune as a faithful retainer and it is said that he died with his lord at Koromogawa no Tachi, the residence of the Oshu Fujiwara clan.
